ThingDef.label: emperor toxisol tree
ThingDef.description: A highly mutated subspecies of the emperor parasol, solely found growing in regions with ash rich ground, and high levels of pollution. Its stem hardens into an almost wood-like material as it matures. Several large pustules can be found growing on the underside of the cap. These pustules will often burst when the tree is felled, releasing clouds of toxic gas into the air.

ThingDef.label: weeping mouldcap tree
ThingDef.description: A highly mutated subspecies of the weeping leathercap tree, solely found growing in regions with ash rich ground, and high levels of pollution. It can only be found growing in certain ashland regions. Its stem hardens into an almost wood-like material as it matures. While not as durable as normal wood, it is comparatively more fire resistant.\n\nOnce it has matured enough, the leathery material of the cap will also be harvested, and can be used to make heat resistant clothes.
